Class BoggleCube

java.lang.Object
  BoggleCube

public class BoggleCube
extends java.lang.Object

Program that takes in a 24 character string and sets each character to a location on the cube. The program also takes in a list of words. The program then tries to see which of the words on the list can be found on the cube.

Author:
ryanegan

Field Detail

count

int count
Constructor Detail

BoggleCube

public BoggleCube(java.lang.String filenameString,
                  java.lang.String filenameWords)
Constructor for boggle cube object. Reads in the word list and the string of characters. Sets the edges of each space on the board. Adds each space to the array of spaces. Gives the spaces the proper character value. Then starts the recursive search for each word.

Parameters:
filenameString - is the variable for the 24 characters
filenameWords - is the string variable for the word list
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method used to run boggle cube.

recursiveFind

public boolean recursiveFind(Space space,
                             java.lang.String original,
                             java.lang.String sub)
Method to search if each word is in the word list. Looks at a word from the word list then recursively tries to find it on the cube. Creates a string to compare to the original string to see if there is a match.

Parameters:
space - the space that the method is currently looking at
original - is the word from the word list that it is trying to match
sub - is the current sub-string that has been created to compare to original
